-Executive Secretary to the Committee on Budget and Finance, and to the Audit Committee at the International Criminal Court (ICC)

school.name: Northwestern University - Kellogg School of Management

company.name: International Criminal Court - Cour Pénale Internationale

profile_positions.description:
M. Fakhri Dajani a été nommé Fonctionnaire chargé des finances et de l'administration en avril 2009 au sein du Secrétariat de l'Assemblée des États Parties. Outre ses fonctions au Secrétariat, M. Dajani a collaboré de près avec le Comité du budget et des finances à la préparation de ses travaux administratifs et financiers.  
M. Dajani a su pleinement s’investir dans des fonctions difficiles et complexes nécessitant une triple compétence juridique, financière et managériale.
Avec beaucoup de dévouement et de compétence, il a participé à l’ensemble des travaux du CBF en facilitant le travail de cet organe.
Disponible, fidèle, professionnel, M. Dajani a également collabore régulièrement avec la présidence de l’AEP, la Cour et le groupe de travail de La Haye sur des sujets sensibles.
M. Dajani a assume avec rigueur et détermination ses fonctions entre les sessions du CBF et a été un relai essentiel du président pour administrer les affaires.
C’est un cadre dirigeant qui s’est totalement investi dans ses fonctions.
Homme intègre, droit et compétent, M. Dajani sait agir en professionnel au profit du CBF et de la Cour.
Esprit ouvert aux novations, cet agent n’hésite pas à apporter régulièrement des améliorations au travail du CBF. Gilles Finkelstein-2013
profile_positions.title: Executive Secretary to the Committee on Budget and Finance
Executive Secretary to the Committee on Budget and Finance and to the Audit Committee

profile_positions.description:
In 2009, Fakhri joined the International Criminal Court as Finance and Administration Officer and worked closely with the Committee on Budget and Finance. In addition, he was given additional and more senior responsibilities to act as Executive Secretary to the Committee.
Fakhri has demonstrated outstanding integrity applying the highest standards for conformity to the organizational rules and interests. His outstanding professionalism and dedication is evident not only in the long hours and quality output at work but also in the prioritising of the office's operations even in times of challenging workload. 
Fakhri is an excellent team player. This was very evident when dealing with 12 members of the Committee without any problem, and when working with staff from different offices, as well as dealing with delegations from States Parties. Fakhri responsibly and on many occasions has shown creative problem solving ability, and well within the rules. Fakhri's interaction with Court official and States Parties has positively reflected on the work of the Committee in addressing different issues, and has opened more channels of communication. Santiago Wins-2012
profile_positions.title: Finance and Administration Officer

profile_positions.description: Fakhri joined UNMIK in very challenging times and has proven to be solid, professional and exhibited leadership as well as team spirit. He has undertaken not only additional duties as OiC GSS which he has delivered outstandingly but also taken much of the CAS workload Fakhri's leadership delivered on the mass checkout of Police and Justice component of several throusand over 4 week period. Fakhri's knowledge and depth of procurement, finance, property management and personnel rules is well above average and has been extremely advantagous to the mission operations and decision making process in his AO responsibilities. Fakhri was given the lead for the DMS reconfiguration workplan to coordinate the planning and implementation for the drawdown of UNMIK assets, premises and personnel in accordance with the Sec-Gen instuctions and budget limits.   This has required indepth knowledge of property management rules, legal paramters concerning premise owndership, and HR rules and regulations related to reconfiguration. After the departure of the DMS AO, Fakhri additionally took the lead in the AO/DMS projects and responsibilities which included coordination with EULEX, focal point for the mission's Audit responses and daily rapport with the CTSS Section Chiefs.  This included the advisory role on Results Based Budgeting and implementaiton of expenditures in accordance with the budget. Fakhri responsibly and on many occasions has shown creative problem solving ability, and well within the rules, as for example was the solution he successfully proposed to EULEX to agree to reimburse UNMIK for a short period (of several days) prior to termination date of UNMIK's camp services supply contract during the transitional period of overlap between UNMIK formed police units and EULEX takeover under SCR1244, saving the organisation monies and avoiding any termination penalties as full contractual notice period was honoured with this solution. Romana Rauf-2009
profile_positions.title: Administrative Officer

company.name: United Nations Office of Internal Oversight Services

profile_positions.company: United Nations Office of Internal Oversight Services
profile_positions.description:
For the End of Mandate Audit, Mr. Dajani contributed to the overall assignment planning and organizing.  As a team member, audited the EU - Pillar IV in Kosovo.   Key economic institutions are entrusted to Pillar IV, which is a large and complicated pillar.  Mr. Dajani had a good understanding of the nature and complexity of these operations in a short period of time.  The audit of UNMIK Pillar IV focussed on key areas of risk emerged from a risk assessment.  Mr. Dajani’s work focussed on the Economic Regulatory Bodies.  The audit presented a number of challenging situations, in which Mr. Dajani demonstrated a high degree of professionalism and competencies in gaining an understanding of the client’s perspectives.  He communicated well with the client and kept his team informed of relevant information and developments during the audit as well as showing initiative in contributing to the overall team performance.  The outputs of the audit of Pillar IV, including the risk based approach, were presented by the Service Chief during the retreat of IAD in New York in December 2007.  The results of the audit are included in a report to the General Assembly.
The comprehensive nature of the assignment required strong skills in assimilating data, synthesizing the information, and assessing processes and controls. Mr. Dajani demonstrated competencies in analyzing business processes, sharing knowledge, coping with pressure and difficult situations.  He contributed to the success of the assignment and his findings on weaknesses in internal controls at Regulators are included in the Report to the General Assembly.  I thank Mr. Dajani for his hard work and contribution to this achievement. Mr. Dajani acted professionally when he represented the Office of the Resident Auditor and showed particular strengths when dealing with administrative matters. Berner Matthee-2008
